ProcessorAffinity Namespace Reference

These methods aid with setting the processor affinity of the main thread This has to be done so that the timing can be done as accurately as possible. More...


Functions

void set (uint32 processorHint)
 This sets the affinity for the app to the given processors.
uint32 get ()
 This gets the processor mask that the application is running on.
void update ()
 This makes sure that the process is running on the right processor.

Detailed Description

These methods aid with setting the processor affinity of the main thread This has to be done so that the timing can be done as accurately as possible.

Function Documentation

void ProcessorAffinity::set ( uint32  processorHint = 0  ) 

This sets the affinity for the app to the given processors.

Parameters:
processor the processor to set the affinity to, please note that this is only a hint, if the processor is not available the first available processor will be chosen

uint32 ProcessorAffinity::get (  ) 

This gets the processor mask that the application is running on.

void ProcessorAffinity::update (  ) 

This makes sure that the process is running on the right processor.
